fields.description: Seems to crash when collapsing any item in that list
fields.summary: Crashed expanding "branches" list in a repository

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to use the delete key to delete items on the sidebar that can be deleted, particularly Stash items when you're cleaning up a group of them.
fields.summary: Allow delete key to work on the sidebar for items which can be deleted

fields.description:
ST crashes when adding branch or remote to a brand new repository.

1) Created repo in the browser
2) Created a repository on local disk
3) Tried to add a remote from Hosted Repositories >> crash
4) Tried to add a new branch >> crash
fields.summary: ST crashes when adding branch or remote

fields.description: except for creating repositories in stash and managing permissions we prefer to work only inside SourceTree. my colleague can create a pull request but I need to be able to review the pull request and merge it all directly from SourceTree without the need to go to the stash site
fields.summary: Add support for working with stash pull requests directly and only from SourceTree

fields.description:
Optional setting to skip pull & push dialogs will be very handy and time saver.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/234571/is-there-a-way-to-skip-pull-push-dialogs
fields.summary: Optional setting to skip pull & push dialogs

fields.description:
In the commit dialog, you can no longer use the checkboxes to select changes to stage.

In the screenshot I know the checkbox is irrelevant since I only have one change at the moment, but they are always disabled no matter how many changes.
fields.summary: Working Copy Changes checkboxes disabled in commit dialog

fields.description: Would be good to calculate the number of pushes only for the current branch. For other branches it is shown in the tree view. This would help to improve usability because all other actions are for current branch as well.
fields.summary: Calculate push count for current branch
Add commandline options to SourceTree.exe to open/import repos

fields.description:
In the pull dialog the effective merge or rebase behaviour of the pull operation should be presented.

Currently, if {{branch.<name>.rebase}} is set, the {{rebase}} checkbox in the pull dialog is not checked, but when performing the pull operation, a rebase takes place. (see SRCTREEWIN-1146)

If the {{branch.<name>.rebase}} and {{pull.rebase}} configs determine the effective behaviour, this should be visible (and maybe overridable for the pull operation triggered by the dialog).
fields.summary: Make effective merge/rebase behaviour visible in the pull dialog before pulling

fields.description: if a file is added to the repository which is just named ' then when you try to add it to staging (ie you deleted it cause who the f names their files ') source tree tries to add bin directories and a ton of other files that normally get ignored to the staging area
fields.summary: file named ' causes all sorts of problems for source tree

fields.description: Diff windows should allow copy (e.g. there are some situation where you need to quickly copy a variable name or a method or whatever) without resetting.
fields.summary: Allow copy on diff window
Display better message when diff is suppressed

fields.description:
It would be really nice to hook the github-windows://... protocol with SourceTree to allow easy cloning from GitHub repositories directly from the browser instead of copying the clone- (or project-) URL into the actual window or even manually starting up the application.

A registration could also work along with GitHub for Windows due to Windows' dynamic association of protocol handlers in the system control panel.
fields.summary: Support for github-windows:// protocol handler

fields.description: If like me, you Pin Sourcetree to the start menu so it's always available, when Sourcetree updates itself, pinned shortcuts are removed.
fields.summary: Updating sourcetree removes user pinned start menu shortcuts.

fields.description:
SourceTree seems to not respect diff limit (size or max line limits) set in options.

When working with big text files, SourceTree hang and crach when clicking on one of those files. It's especially problematic when you open a repository and one of those file is selected by default.
fields.summary: Diff limit not respected for new or deleted file

fields.description: Today I tried to open SourceTree and, surprise, I'm not able to because I get an immediate crash after opening.
fields.summary: Crash when trying to Open the program

fields.description: All files with name "default.php" are displayed as binary. Other php files are displayed correctly (as text).
fields.summary: File default.php is displayed as binary file

fields.description: when selecting files in 'Working Copy Changes' window using shift+arrow, diff window on right tries to continuously update making selection too slow and unresponsive when several files are selected using this method
fields.summary: select files in 'Working Copy Changes' window using shift+down arrow

fields.description:
When pulling using rebase instead of merge, it doesn't allow it if there are uncommitted changes. What people usually do is manually stash the changes, do a rebase pull, then manually apply the changes back.

It'd be nice that there is an option in the settings to turn the manual steps to automatic:
1. When a rebase pull action is initiated, if there are uncommitted changes, automatically stash the changes.
2. After the rebase pull is successfully completed, automatically apply the changes back, or offer a dialog asking if the user wants to apply the changes back. Whether to show such a dialog can also be in the settings too.
fields.summary: Auto stash before a rebase pull and pop stash after a successful rebase

fields.description: Can you add an option for starting a Gitflow support branch
fields.summary: Add option for Git-Flow support branches

fields.description:
I need to use the ours strategy i.e. merge myBranch into master, discarding any changes on myBranch

git merge -s ours myBranch
fields.summary: Any support for Merge startegies

fields.description: Got quite a few mis-spellings in commit messages, would be really nice of Sourcetree did some kind of spell checking and maintain a dictionary of custom words.
fields.summary: Would be nice of commit messages had automatic spell checking and squiggly underlining

fields.description:
When deleting a remote branch there should be an option whether to delete the branch also in the remote repository or not (only in the local one).

Currently a remote branch is also deleted on the remote side, which I found quite surprising. In my opinion this should happen only if I say so.
fields.summary: Don't delete remote branches on remote side per default

fields.description: If you blame a file and view a commit in separate log window the commit message isn't parsed for user defined links. Would be great to support the links in that window as well,
fields.summary: Add commit text links to log window

fields.description: It's happened 3 or 4 times today. Opening and closing the Remotes or Branches trees causes a crash.
fields.summary: Click the minus sign next to Remotes or Branches sometimes causes a crash

fields.description:
I am trying to do a checkout.  When the error:
  error: Unable to open .git/HEAD.lock for writing
happens, SourceTree, thinks it succeeded but it actually failed.
Here's the full output in the "Switching branch" dialog with "Show Full Output" checked:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false reset -q --hard HEAD --

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout master
error: Unable to open .git/HEAD.lock for writing
Switched to branch 'master'



git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false submodule update --init --recursive
Completed successfully.

I've also attached a print screen.
fields.summary: Error when .git/HEAD.lock can't be written to is not handled properly

fields.description:
It would be usefull to filter or sort the repository list by branches, so it's easier to see on which branches you are working (especially in projects with multiple modules (20+)).

Another possibility would be to mark certain branches with custom colors.
fields.summary: Filter and sort repository list by branch

fields.description:
When I try to reverse a file, that is currently open in another program, SourceTree crashes.

I'd expect some nice error message.

Reproduction:
- Add a Word file to the repo.
- Commit it
- Open the file outside of sourceTree (i.e. not via the "open after" button)
- Click "Reverse"
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when reversing file

fields.description:
Reproduction:

# checkout Remotes/origin/very-long-branch-name w/ tracking
# rename Branches/very-long-branch-name to Branches/shortname
# reset tracking of Branches/shortname to Remotes/origin/very-long-branch-name (if it changed)

To witness the issues:

* issue 1
# right click Branches/shortname
# Push to origin/very-long-branch-name

Notice "Remote branch" is "shortname". It should be "very-long-branch-name".

* issue 2
# click "Push" icon in icon ribbon

Notice "Remote branch" is empty.
fields.summary: Original remote branch tracking is ignored for push after local branch rename

fields.description:
Hi I have notised a small "bug"

How to recreate

Add new Remote 
In Url / Path: field write:
\\nas03\Git\Pcalc-api\v1\
(Or any file share you have)

And try to push.
This will give this error:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags --set-upstream origin master:master
Pushing to \\nas03\Git\Pcalc-api\v1\

fatal: '\nas03\Git\Pcalc-api\v1\' does not appear to be a git repository

Note the message in fatal there is only one \ in front of \\nas03

If I instead put 4 \ in the start of url/path
\\\\nas03\Git\Pcalc-api\v1\
All works fine.



My .gitconfig

[user]
	name = Niels
	email = z@z.zz
[core]
	autocrlf = true
	excludesfile = C:\\Users\\nielsl\\Documents\\gitignore_global.txt
[difftool "sourcetree"]
	cmd = 'C:/Program Files/Perforce/p4merge.exe' \"$LOCAL\" \"$REMOTE\"
[mergetool "sourcetree"]
	cmd = 'C:/Program Files/Perforce/p4merge.exe' \"$BASE\" \"$LOCAL\" \"$REMOTE\" \"$MERGED\"
	trustExitCode = true
[push]
	default = simple
[gui]
	recentrepo = E:/Dev/wifihotspots/hern
	recentrepo = E:/Dev/wifihotspot
fields.summary: Url - filepath small problem

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this is not a duplicate of [SRCTREEWIN-897], but I find it pretty dangerous that SourceTreeApp in version 1.3.1.0  let you commit on a detached HEAD without a warning.

This happens often when people work within submodules, makes a commit of the top-level project and get the "Submodule Check" window that tells to commit changes in submodules, then they do so and get their new commit on no branch, just pointed by HEAD because they didn't checkout any valid branch before.

It's the default git behaviour to checkout the referenced commit of a submodule as detached HEAD and this is not possible to change, but it's IMHO really important to warn the user that he is commiting on a detached HEAD. 

Git gui warn the user after clicking commit, which isn't the case of Source Tree App, and I think this would be nice, because people tends to "loose" their HEAD in such cases.
fields.summary: No warning when commiting on a Detached HEAD

fields.description:
Adding a Stash Repository on the pannel. I don't know WHY you call it stash instead of 'Custom repository' or whatever more revelant. (And I spend one our to understand that I needed to select Stash, because I'm not English native, and Stash is never used in ordinary computer science softwares.

So the critical error cause SourceTree to crash : here it is ! (Please check that the user can copy paste his password in the panel, and do not create a default BitBucket Account as we use this software as a client, not as propagation of Attlassian technologies... make it simple man, it will be more powerfull)

Also, please test SourceTree on Assembla.com with a Git Repository and a simple hello world versionned text file.

Chris - Computer Science Master Degree student at the University Of Orléans (France)

fields.summary: Stash Bug - Adding remote repository

fields.description: The discard changes option appears to be broken for certain working copy changes. I have used the reset all option under Discard to abandon all local changes but nothing happens whatsoever, the files are still there under working copy changes list even though they were never touched. The project I am working on is cross platform with Linux which has components that require these files to be left in their current case. I'm fairly sure this is due to SourceTree not handling case sensitive file-names at all.
fields.summary: Impossible to discard working copy changes that were never made

fields.description:
When I try to pull new commits from Github, new code is added to my code but SourceTree starts to claim that those codelines are *my* uncommited changes though I haven't written that code.

I clicked "Reset current branch to this commit" and discarded all working copy changes. Then I tried to pull again and the same error appeared again.

\\
Updating e154a37..8077e4a

error: unable to unlink old 'POS/data/POSdb.lck' (Permission denied)

From https://github.com/eliise/teamviis
 * branch            master     -> FETCH_HEAD


Updating e154a37..8077e4a

error: Your local changes to the following files would be overwritten by merge:
	.gitignore
	POS/src/ee/ut/math/tvt/salessystem/ui/tabs/PurchaseTab.java
Please, commit your changes or stash them before you can merge.
Aborting
fields.summary: Teammember's commit transforms to "my" uncommited changes

fields.description: Frequently (though not always) when expanding the Remotes tree of at least one of my Git projects the application completely crashes with a NullReferenceException. This is happening on a project that I only created today - cloned from a fork on github.
fields.summary: Crashes when expanding Remotes tree

fields.description: Please add the option to change the number of spaces in a tab. Currently it's set to 8, which is not my preference (4 spaces per tab)
fields.summary: Add option to change number of spaces in a tab

fields.description:
I sometimes run across cases where in my diff a line appears to be modified but there are no semantic changes. This due to whitespace differences, for instance tabs may have been replaced with spaces or there may be multiple trailing whitespaces at the end of the line.

This is more important for whitespace sensitive languages like Python where indentation is critical.

It would be helpful in the diff window if we could also see whitespace characters in the comparison.
fields.summary: Add an option to show whitespace characters in the diff window

fields.description:
h3.  reproduction 

1. create a custom action like I have (see attached)
2. attempt to run it

h3. observed behavior

crash

h3. expected behavior

any of the following would make sense:
* no reaction (this is what I based the time estimate on)
* warning at run-time: something to the effect of "can't run run your script"
* warning at creation time: something to the effect of "this custom action won't do anything"
fields.summary: dummy custom action = crash

fields.description:
Suddenly, at random moments, the program freezes, and then begins to have a memory and a processor.
This occurs any time from minutes to an hour.
The program will then hang down, and slowly starts to release memory.
fields.summary: Memory leak / wrong algorithm

fields.description:
For our company to find a real replacement in Mercurial+SourceTree we would like to have support for the LockExtension (http://mercurial.selenic.com/wiki/LockExtension). This extension brings a centralized entity into play where users can mark files as locked so to prevent simultanious editing of binary/unmergeable files.
Currently being a Perforce user which supports FileLocking and others to see when a file is locked by another user is one of the few features that we are missing.

"Custom Actions" are a start for now, but it would be really great to have a visual on what is locked at the moment for the users. sourcetree could request this locked files on a regular basis or something.
fields.summary: Support for the HG LockExtension

fields.description:
If you have a single file with modifications and you click the commit button, then that file should be staged automatically for you in the commit dialog.

It's pretty clear what the users intention is, and they can always unstage that file if they so choose.
fields.summary: When comitting, automatically stage a single file

fields.description:
When adding or editing a hosted repository in SourceTree, if "Stash" is selected as a "Hosting Service", there is no dropdown to choose a "Preferred Protocol". 

Would be nice to have this in order to select between "HTTPS" and "SSH".
fields.summary: Add Preferred Protocols For Stash

fields.description:
Every operation made on a Git repository that needs a server connection fails with the crash of sh.exe:

Problem signature:
  Problem Event Name:	APPCRASH
  Application Name:	sh.exe
  Application Version:	0.0.0.0
  Application Timestamp:	5236e84c
  Fault Module Name:	ntdll.dll
  Fault Module Version:	6.3.9600.16408
  Fault Module Timestamp:	523d45fa
  Exception Code:	40010006
  Exception Offset:	000aa1e5
  OS Version:	6.3.9600.2.0.0.16.7
  Locale ID:	2064
  Additional Information 1:	2556
  Additional Information 2:	2556cfcb99465923f433625e0ec841fe
  Additional Information 3:	6e83
  Additional Information 4:	6e83a153d98bd855afcdd4b6090fb9c0

Read our privacy statement online:
  http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=280262

If the online privacy statement is not available, please read our privacy statement offline:
  C:\Windows\system32\en-US\erofflps.txt
fields.summary: sh.exe has stopped working (APPCRASH)

fields.description: It would be nice to start SourceTree from a command prompt and specify, on the command line, the local git repo to be displayed.
fields.summary: Specify git repo on SourceTree command line

fields.description: It would be nice to have one config file in a DropBox or SkyDrive folder, and use that config on various computers.
fields.summary: Allow user to specify location of SourceTree config file

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to specify the command shell to use, rather than merely a choice between bash and cmd -- I generally use Powershell with posh-git for my git command line.
fields.summary: Allow user to specify command shell

fields.description:
We only have one repository, so we never use the bookmarks pane, as it takes up valuable screen real estate.

However the one feature we do miss is the Explore shortcut context menu.  Would it be possible to add Explore to the context menu of the project tabs to open Explorer in the correct directory.
fields.summary: Explore context menu when bookmarks pane is not open.

fields.description: Comments, i.e. lines starting with "#", are not stripped from the commit message when committing but are committed literally as part of the message. This is inconvenient especially when using a commit template (see SRCTREEWIN-1209) with comments. A user would have to remove all comments from the template manually before committing to not have them be part of the message.
fields.summary: Option to strip comments from commit message (for templates)

fields.description: This sort of duplicates SRCTREE-982 for Windows. Could we please have support for commit templates in the Windows version, too?
fields.summary: Add support for commit templates

fields.description:
After a fresh and apparently successful installation of SourceTree on Windows 7 64-bit:

a) Clicking on the Windows Start button shows the "Check For Updates" menu item, not the "SourceTree" menu item, in the portion of the Start menu that Windows manages dynamically (i.e., to feature newly installed and recently use applications).

b) Clicking the "Check For Updates" item in the Start Menu results in an "Invalid or missing updates configuration file" error message box.

c) After finding and launching SourceTree, choosing "Help | Check for Updates" from the application menu bar results in the same error message.

Note: I am connecting through a corporate web proxy server.
fields.summary: Invalid or Missing updates configuration file

fields.description:
SourceTree could offer a way to add commit message filters.

This way one could e.g. automatically add a link to to an issue tracker given a specific repository/origin.

For example commit messages in the TYPO3.CMS repository could automatically have their issue references link to TYPO3 Forge.
fields.summary: Commit message filter

fields.description: Currently the Custom Actions items are nice, but very limited. I would like to be able to launch separate processes and have more variables at our disposal. For example, I would like to be able to create a command (or change the "terminal" command, to launch powershell, instead of the standard windows terminal. As for the extra variables, we need at least a $BRANCH variable with the branch name, or maybe a $LBranch and $RBranch for Local and Remote branch names. These variables are a necessity for configuring Source Tree to work well in a Git/TFS environment. as many commands for Git TFS require an -i $BRANCH type parameter to tell it which branch to target.
fields.summary: Custom Actions - More options

fields.description:
When performing a clone, a 'working' type progress bar is shown that simply indicates that a process is being performed. This gives no indication of how long the process will take or at what stage the process is. The message window below it also provides no current status messages except from the starting and ending messages. 

I have several large projects to clone and they take a long time (hours), I have no way of knowing if the process is simply taking a long time or if it has failed. For this reason I used TortoiseGIT because this has a full progress bar and a constantly updated message window describing the current operation. It would be great if SourceTree had a similar progress bar when doing a clone.
fields.summary: Show a progress bar when cloning

fields.description:
Hello!

We have private git repository, which has a firewall rule to block IP address on many simultaneous ssh connections. And SourceTree is used to monitor more than 15 repositories hosted at this server...

So, It would be great if you will add some kind of time delay between checking remote repositories on SourceTree startup.

Thank you in advance.
fields.summary: Delay between checking remote repositories on SourceTree startup

fields.description:
I'm getting the message below when adding files in this directory:

C:\Users\developer\Versioned\Conferences\2013\20131104-EKON-17-Day-1-Köln-Germany

This looks like a unicode problem, or a directory depth problem.

Message:

hg remove -y -f 2013\20131104-EKON-17-Day-1-K�ln-Germany\Cross-Plattform-Entwicklung-mit-Delphi-Android-iOS-Mac-und-Windows\Cross-Plattform-Entwicklung-mit-Delphi-Android-iOS-Mac-und-Windows.md 2013\20131105-EKON-17-Day-2-K�ln-Germany\Smart-Mobile-Studio\Smart-Mobile-Studio.md
not removing 2013\20131104-EKON-17-Day-1-K�ln-Germany\Cross-Plattform-Entwicklung-mit-Delphi-Android-iOS-Mac-und-Windows\Cross-Plattform-Entwicklung-mit-Delphi-Android-iOS-Mac-und-Windows.md: file is untracked

not removing 2013\20131105-EKON-17-Day-2-K�ln-Germany\Smart-Mobile-Studio\Smart-Mobile-Studio.md: file is untracked

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: While adding HG files I get a message about removing them

fields.description:
May I request that on the bookmarks pane, only the bookmark for the active repository tab is emphasized (and that the emphasis switches when the active repository tab is changed)?

This will prevent a momentary confusion which happens because the bookmarks selection highlight does not change as different repository tabs are activated.

(Alternatively, when a repository tab is activated, might the selection highlight of a bookmark be removed if it is for a different repository?)
fields.summary: Only emphasize bookmark for active repository tab

fields.description:
Using Stash to view Git Repository.
Used Clone Button to select Clone in Source Tree.
Source Tree was not open at the time.
5 Second delay from Google Chrome Question Dialog box for allowing an application to be launched with Chrome.
Launched Source Tree from All Programs Menu.
Upon Launch exception was thrown during retrieval of repository. 

Source Tree Log File contains information.
fields.summary: Exception issue created upon launch of Source Tree.

fields.description:
At a conference we had no internet connection for about 14 hours.
I just rebooted and started SourceTree, and it has taken 100% for at least 15 minutes now keeping calling hg.exe instances.
I'm not sure why, I tried taking some screenshots, but since the upstream now is filled with conference attendees syncing stuff I'll try to upload later.

Right now ST is unusable, so I'll have ProcessExplorer sleep it, then try later, and in the mean time use TortoiseHG to upload my stuff.
fields.summary: High CPU usage in HG module

fields.description: Allow us to select which files in a given stash that should be applied.
fields.summary: Apply part of stash

fields.description: When creating a new project or cloning in SourceTree hooks are not copied down to the project from the {{init.templatedir}} variable. It always copies the hooks from the default git directory ({{C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\share\git-core\templates\hooks}}).
fields.summary: SourceTree Does Not Use init.templatedir Variable When Creating New Project or Cloning

fields.description:
I have Ubuntu 12.04.3 in a VMware VM on the same machine with root mapped through Samba:

[root]
        comment = localDev System Root
        path = /
        writeable = yes
        browseable = yes
        valid users = devuser
        force user = root
        force group = root
        create mask = 0644
        directory mask = 0755

I have a Git repo on Ubuntu which is clean (no pending changes indicated with 'git status').  When I view that repo through the Samba map in SoucreTree, three files are indicated as changed.  The change is in permissions: "Modified file, mode 10755->100644".  The files in question are set executable, so 10755 is the correct permissions – they have not been changed to 100644.  Maybe Samba modifies the executable flag so that SourceTree sees it as 100644?  If that is the case, it would be good to add an option to _not_ track changes in file permissions if the problem can't be otherwise fixed.
fields.summary: File permissions seen incorrectly through a Samba map

fields.description: When I have my collection of stashes open and then collapse them it crashes the application.
fields.summary: Application Crash when Collapse Stash Collection

fields.description:
SourceTree used to allow diffing utf-16 in UI but it does not work anymore.  It was accomplished using the following in .gitattributes:

[attr]utf16 diff merge -crlf
*.sj utf16

I have an old version installed (.9.2.3) where it would read this and would display in the viewer panel, allowing all the associated functionality.  Can this be fixed?  I'd rather not convert the files to UTF-8 or stay on the old version.  This declaration works fine for other external viewers, it tells git to treat the file as text.
fields.summary: SourceTree no longer displays UTF-16 when .gitattributes properly configured

fields.description:
It seems that source tree will always start on my main monitor when maximized. If I restore the window and place it on the secondary monitor, it will open there.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Start SourceTree
2) Move it to the secondary screen and maximize it there
3) Close SourceTree
4) Start SourceTree
= Source tree now starts maximized on the primary monitor instead of the secondary.
fields.summary: Open on the wrong monitor in dual monitor setup.

fields.description: 1.2.3 update mechanism does not reveal updates though 1.3.1 is out: it says there are no updates.
fields.summary: 1.2.3 update mechanism does not reveal updates though 1.3.1 is out.

fields.description:
I have a Mercurial-renamed file which is shown in the "Show Pending" list with the swoopy arrow.

But External Diff is greyed out in the main menu and the context menu, and the keyboard shortcut does not work.

The "External Diff" button to the upper right of the diff display, however, does start an external diff. But in my Beyond Compare, it shows an empty left side and all lines to the right as changes.

In TortoiseHg, I am able to start an external diff on the same uncommitted rename and see a proper diff.
fields.summary: For renamed file, External Diff is not active through menu or keyboard but is active (sort of) through button

fields.description: While attempting to add a remote to an existing repo, I noticed that copying the remote's address (from Firefox) and attempting to paste into the remote address field in the add remote dialog, does not work. The contents of the clipboard contents were able to be pasted anywhere else however.
fields.summary: Paste not working in add remote dialog

fields.description: If I want to see the history in a specific folder, on the command line I type "git log /folder/". It would be great, if it would be possible to apply such a file/folder-filter in the visual client as well.
fields.summary: Filter Log / History by path

fields.description:
Switching branches is not possible within SourceTree if there are uncommitted changes in the sandbox - you have to commit first ...

On the other hand, this is possible on commandline via "git checkout -m ..." , forcing git to merge the uncommited files ...

FEATURE REQUEST: Expose possibility to select "-m" option on switching branches within SourceTree

----
UserStory: User edited a file, without recognizing that he is on the wrong branch. He wants to checkout another branch and commit the changes (not committed before switching - as the changes do not belong to the erroneous branch) on the switched branch

Currently you save the changes on the file out of the sandbox, discard the changes within the sandboxed file, switch the branches and copy/manually merge the copied file back into sandbox ... This is quite annoying esp. as git itself offers the solution to handle this situation
fields.summary: Expose Option "-m" on switching branches

fields.description:
Currently: In Search Tab, there are 3 types Commit messages, File Changes, Authors.

Wanted: Search type: "Branch name"

Problem: For each bug or feature I am using new branch (Git Flow process). Branch name usually use BugTracker id. Number of non-merged branches sometimes increase a lot, so I need to visually go through whole branch tree or search by commits (assuming BugTracker id is in Commit message and branch points to last commit message).
Moreover, branches can be created without commit messages (e.g. stashed to fix more critical one).
fields.summary: Search by branch name

fields.description: Instead of a window for each command showing GIT output, please create a pane that constantly shows command output. MAC version already has this: SRCTREE-1284
fields.summary: Console/Output View

fields.description:
Crash while removing 2nd remote repository in 'remotes'
However the action seems to be executed correctly.
fields.summary: Crash while removing 2nd remote repository in 'remotes'

fields.description:
There is a rollback function available in Mercurial which I sometime ends up using. It work only on the last commit. 
See: http://hgbook.red-bean.com/read/finding-and-fixing-mistakes.html#sec:undo:rollback

(not sure this link is up to date on the syntaxe)

A button or action to do this from SourceTree would allow me to not have to do it from command line or from TortoiseHg.
fields.summary: Add a Rollback action when appropriate.

fields.description:
(it's have been there for a long time but I didn't found the time to post it)

When I want to delete a file from the repository, I often do it by deleting the file first, then use the Working Copy view to review what I just did and commit the change.

In the commit screen, selecting new files that are not tracked will result in a prompt asking if I want to add them (which I want most of the time).
However, selecting files that have been deleted will result in nothing. Neither prompt nor removed from the repository.

This is problematic because almost each time I want to delete files, I first do a commit, then realize the deleted files *that were selected on commit* have not been removed from tracking, and *there is no prompt telling me so*. So I have to do another commit or rollback if I realized it soon enough. (but rollback action isn't visible from SourceTree so each time I have to do it from command line)

(Preferred) Suggestion 1: use a solution similar to TortoiseHg.
In TortoiseHg, selecting untracked files on commit will result in a prompt asking if we really want to add these files - exactly like SourceTree.
However, selecting deleted files on commit will result in another prompt asking if we really want to remove these files - not like SourceTree. 
This is "elegant" in that it's a symmetric behavior (if we could say that).
Note that TortoiseHg prompt twice if you have added and deleted files in the same commit (which I do each time I totally remove sources from a dependency and replace it by a new version of this dependency sources). I found it very helpful.

Suggestion 2 (less elegant I think): Don't allow selecting untracked or deleted files for commit if they are not yet associated with a valid action (either add or remove). This would force the user to choose explicitely what to do with these before committing them or let them untracked. I think it might work too but I didn't try it, while the solution used in TortoiseHg always worked very well for me. Maybe this solution is safer though.

I guess we could say Suggestion 1 is "implicit" in that it is assuming that selecting a deleted file for commit means the user wants it removed from tracking (with a prompt to be sure that's what's intended); while Suggestion 2 is "explicit" in that it will allow action on a deleted file until it's either explicitly removed or restored.
fields.summary: Committing deleted files don't remove tracking.

fields.description:
All in the title.

I often try things and discard them afterward and it's getting annoying to have to first discard then remove the orig file, with a prompt to be sure for each operation.

Suggestion: add a check box or a button in the discard prompt to allow the user to choose to not generate the orig file (either by using mercurial options or by deleting it after the discard automatically).
fields.summary: Allow discarding files without generating .orig files

fields.description:
I attempted to finish a feature by using the Git Flow -> Finish Feature for my feature branch. When I clicked the button, the screen populated correctly and then immediately erased the feature branch name in both the drop down on top and the proposed branch name in the branch list (it went from "feature/ODY-690" to "feature/" in the proposed commit title).

The "OK" button grayed out as well.

My workaround was to check it in on another machine which was running version 1.2.4.0.
fields.summary: Finish Feature does not seem to work in Git Flow anymore

fields.description:
When I try to install an update, the following error appears:
"Invalid Drive: P:\"
and the installation fails.

P: is a drive letter linked with the subst command to a folder containing my projects, some of them opened in sourcetree.
fields.summary: Can't update if there is a folder "mounted" with subst.

fields.description:
The Refresh Remote Status feature doesn't work. I cloned several repos hosted on Github, and from time to time I would click the "Refresh Remote Status" but nothing happened, although I was sure that there were changes (by viewing on Github). If I clicked Pull, the pull always succeeded (with the changes)

Another suggestion is that if I click on Refresh Remote Status, and there are indeed no change, please notice me so (by a dialog box for example) instead of saying nothing.
fields.summary: Refresh Remote Status doesn't work

fields.description:
1. Installed Source Tree.
2. Launched, software asked me to download Mercurial addition. Seems working, then I closed it.
3. Next day I made a private repo on bitbucket.
4. Then I cloned it from bitbucket.
5. After I'm trying to create a new branch it crashes with message like "we don't know what's going on, seems we've got an exception blah blah".
6. After I'm trying to relaunch it an exception is occurs again. Seems like application is trying to create it again and crashes. I can't use it right now.
fields.summary: Application crashes after I trying to create a branch

fields.description:
Sequence of actions/events:
# I cloned a bare git-repo from a file-server
# Then I deleted "origin" from within SourceTree.
# SourceTree crashed.
# When I started up SourceTree again, the "origin" remote was deleted (as intended).

From the SourceTree log:

{noformat}
2013-10-29T13:11:21: Fatal error: 
System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: collection

2013-10-29T13:11:21: Stack trace: 
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.DeleteRemote(String remote)
   at System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.InvokeClickAfterRender(Object arg)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Crashed when deleted remote "origin"

fields.description:
If multiple commit links are present in a message, then the message does not get displayed correctly.

Here is an example commit message:

<---
Analyser - ScanChainController crash adding pin to list that need to be updated more than once.

Unsure how this happens but this looks to be the place where it occurs, so make more defensive.

Review 5356
Bug 8239
-->

We have two rules:
  [Bb]ug (\d+)  ->  http://bugs.ctg.local/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=$1
  [Rr]eview (\d+)  ->  http://review:8080/ui#review:id=$1

The commit text is displayed in SourceTree like this (I have enclosed the text that is made into a hyperlink with double square brackets):

<--
Analyser - ScanChainController crash adding pin to list that need to be updated more than once.

Unsure how this happens but this looks to be the place where it occurs, so make more defensive.

Review 5356
Analyser - ScanChainController crash adding pin to list that need to be updated more than once.

Unsure how this happens but this looks to be the place where it occurs, so make more defensive.

[[Review 5356]]
[[Bug 8239]]
-->
fields.summary: Multiple commit text links cause commit text to be duplicated

fields.description:
It would also be nice to allow the user to create a code review in Crucible from commits selected in the Log/History tab.

And also Create Code reviews from uncommitted changes.

Similar to how crucible.py works.
fields.summary: Integrate with Crucible

fields.description:
It would be good to be able to integrate with other Atlassian products like JIRA

The main feature I'd like is to enforce the user to input a JIRA KEY for each commit message.
fields.summary: Integrate with JIRA

fields.description:
After adding a commit-text-link using the "other" option (to link to lighthouse), the setting appeared to be accepted. 

After making a commit, sourcetree crashed. Subsequent opens of the application result in a crash (i.e. program is unusable).

This is possibly the same issue as SRCTREEWIN-1157 but affects non-Jira url so I don't know if the fix applies.

fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes after commit (and all subsequent application starts) when commit text link specified

fields.description:
SourceTree does not work with smooth scrolling from touchpad but works well with mouse scroll.

Need to support smooth scrolling too.
fields.summary: Smooth Scrolling compability

fields.description:
Modified: 
---------------
I uninstalled SourceTree and re-installed and it works OK now.

OK to close/reject the Issue:

Thanks
srini


Original:
------------
I had a crashed disk. I recovered Source code from the crashed disk, Installed Source Tree (and .NET) on the new disk  and pointed to the Git repository: Source Tree crashed. Log file:
2013-10-28T20:16:05: Fatal error: 
System.MissingFieldException: Field not found: 'href.Utils.EncodingTools.DefaultEncoding'.

2013-10-28T20:16:05: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.Utils.GeneralHelper.GetBestEncodingForFile(String fullPath)

fields.summary: Source Tree crashes on startup

fields.description: When I click the amend previous commit button, it would be nice to see the contents of the previous commit to modify them. I'm not sure if this is feasibly however, and I know that I can do a reset to achieve similar.
fields.summary: Feature req: show previous changes when amending commit

fields.description:
I can select a range of commits and see in the Log/History area the diff of all those changes; fine.

The request I have is that when I begin omitting specific commits from the range, that the Log/History also omit those commits.

The use-case is that I am trying to code review a feature branch that merged in changes from develop, but i don't want to code review what is from develop, just see the sum of all the feature branch changes.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Highlight Multiple Commits Showing Every Commit In Range

fields.description:
The "Dialogs" in SourceTree are not real dialogs that support proper keyboard operation with enter/esc/tab, etc. 

For instance I have not found a way yet to operate the OK button by keyboard in the Commit "Dialogs" for HG and GIT.

If that is at all possible, it should be made dead obvious to the SourceTree user.
fields.summary: "Dialogs" in SourceTree are not real dialogs, so standard keyboard operation often does not work.

fields.description:
Git: when switching away from SourceTree, doing some work, then switching back, the "File Status" and "Log / History" refresh without keeping state.

State like this is lost, making it counter productive:

- Sort order
- File selection

This state however is maintained:

- Kind of selection (Select All; Select Pending, etc)

Please make the refresh keep more state.
fields.summary: Git: when switching away from SourceTree, doing some work, then switching back, the "File Status" and "Log / History" refresh without keeping state.

fields.description:
when one executes a graft operation the number of revisions to push is not increased. only on execution of a push operation does the internal check find the grafted revision to push. The number of revision to push however is not increased.

please make sure to indicate that there are revisions to push.
fields.summary: Applied graft operation is not reflected in number of revisions to push

fields.description:
Checking "After committing, stay in commit dialog if there are still pending changes" causes the commit window to check ALL files after each commit.

I think the whole point of "After committing, stay in commit dialog if there are still pending changes" is that you commit only a subset of your files at a time, not all of them.

So selecting all files after each commit is counter productive, especially since Ctrl-A does not select all files so it is a bit cumbersome to do the "check ALL files".
fields.summary: checking "After committing, stay in commit dialog if there are still pending changes" causes the commit window to check ALL files after each commit.

fields.description: Unlike the "Working Copy Changes" window, the Git "Staged Changes" window has no "Commit" entry in the context menu.
fields.summary: Git "Staged Changes" window has no "Commit" entry in the context menu

fields.description:
The context menu for files contains an option "Copy Path To Clipboard".

In practice, I use the Filename far more often than the complete path (especially since the "Show in Explorer" gets you to the right path anyway).

So please add a context menu "Copy Filename To Clipboard".
fields.summary: Add "Copy Filename To Clipboard" next to "Copy Path To Clipboard"

fields.description:
After starting SourceTree for Windows, I usually rearrange the width/height of the various Windows parts so I can actually see the information I want (FileName, Path, list of local changed files, etc).

Sooner rather than later, SourceTree keeps automagically changing those back to what SourceTree thinks is a reasonable default.

I don't mind having a command resets the Windows to that reasonable default, but SourceTree should not do that automagically.
fields.summary: SourceTree auto-arranges it's Windows seemingly ad-hoc

fields.description:
When reporting bugs, the current "Affected Version/s" list looks like this:

1.2.4
1.2.3
....
1.0.6
1.3.0
1.2.0
...

This counter intuitive. It should be in reverse chronological order (youngest version on top, oldest at the bottom).
fields.summary: Version list Jira is not in reverse chronological order

fields.description:
I'm installing SourceTree in a new Windows 8.1 virtual machine.
After clicking through the installer, I ended up on the final screen with a Back and a Finish button. Both were disabled and had no effect when clicked. Neither the close button or the System menu Close item had any effect.
fields.summary: Finish button on installer is disabled
Sourcetree asks to login to Stash every half hour or so

fields.description: When defining multiple replacements, in my case one Jira and one Regex, everything is fine if only one matches for the commit message. But, if both match it comes to strange issues, e.g. lines are duplicated where a match occurred but other matching words are not recognized.
fields.summary: Commit Text Replacement, Issues with two Replacements

fields.description: It would be awesome if one could view and purge (rewrite history) large git objects. This would make it trivial forking/cleaning up old projects but still retaining commit history (future reference) without those pesky legacy binary blobs hanging around.
fields.summary: Purge large objects
